page.title: 16Attitudes In Culcheth
page.content: We surveyed the parents or neighbours of the 23 children in our class, who live in Culcheth. Most people seemed to think Culcheth was a good place to live. 19 people thought there were enough shops; others wanted more childrenswear shops. 17 people felt that there were enough parks and open areas. The same number agreed that Culcheth is tidy. Over 3/4 of the people interviewed were pleased that there were lots of motorways nearby, but 13 people thought that there should be more buses. 18 people were happy to stay in their present house, the rest would have preferred to live in other parts of Culcheth. Some thought that the amount of traffic was becoming a nuisance;it was getting harder to park at the shops.
